title: Restaurant General Manager
description:
**SMASHBURGER**

**Restaurant General Manager**

Our first Smashburger restaurant opened in 2007 with one single notion in mind; **to serve a better burger**! Better burgers takes better service, support and teamwork. That's why we treat our team members fairly in a diverse and safe environment. With an average of 10 restaurants opening each year, we invest in building internal opportunities for our teams’ learning and growth.” **We just build better**. Better Burgers. Better Teams. Better Experiences.

  

**Better Benefits: Build a better experience work & lifestyle!**

* Quarterly Bonus
* Get Paid $ to Refer your Friends\\*
* RGMs, RMs, & SLs are entitled to one (1) free meal each shift they work \\*
* Paid time off – vacation and sick\\*
* Medical, Dental and Vision Options\\*
* 401K match (21 and older)
* Flexible schedules in a fun, family friendly, team environment
* Employee Assistance Program
* Fast track for career opportunities\\
* Free uniform
* *Eligibility based off of time in position and average hours worked*

* *Referred employees must be manager level and in good standing & Referee must be employed with Smashburger at time of payout. Bonus is paid in two distributions*

  

**Restaurant General Manager Responsibilities**

* Reporting to the Director of Operations/District Manager and is the primary support for the management teams in their respective restaurant location.
* Manage the performance of multiple Restaurant Managers (RM), Shift Leaders (SL) and Employees
* Promote a fun and positive work environment
* Develop future leaders for the company
* Manage the effectiveness of people focused processes and systems
* Ensure individual unit is always staffed adequately which includes: employee retention, communicating staffing needs to DO/Recruiting and checking ATS each morning for new applicant flow, including the selection, development and performance management of employees
* Provide initial and ongoing training to all employees within the unit utilizing SmashConnect LMS, and 4 step method of training
* Reward and recognize employee performance that exceeds company standards
* Engage in talent reviews and performance conversations for all RM/RS in their respective restaurant
* Partner with Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) to manage progressive disciplinary processes that arise with the unit
* Resolve all employee relations issues with the assistance of the DO/SDO and HRBP
* Manage with integrity the daily completion of operational check lists to include
* + Line checks and uniform standards
  + Opening/closing check lists
  + Safe and deposit logs
* Manage FSC operational standards daily and complete a corrective action plan for every FSC audit performed by SDO, DO, and QM
* Manage the guest experience metrics (NPS and OSAT) and resolve all guest complaints within 24 hours of the incident through use of Medallia
* Ensure all food safety standards are followed and in compliance with all local health departments
* Exemplify guest service on each shift of the day and communicates SIZZLE service standards to the employees
* Manage the successful onboarding and training for all new employees
* Facilitate routine management communication
* Manage the businesses spends through allocations and usage of company declining budget
* Manage COGS through PAR ordering management, inventory, and FIFO reporting
* Manage spending in accounts cleaning, small wares, and operating costs
* Follow and ensures company cash policies to ensure minimal losses through theft or shortages
* Build sales through community involvement and improvement of FSC operations within the unit
* Manage labor cost through effective wages within the hourly minimums in accordance to state laws
* Participate in P&L reviews with SDO and DO
* Build schedules based on company forecast tool and allowed labor percentages. While reacting daily to sales trends and reducing labor scheduled when needed
* Manage local store marketing programs as assigned

**Restaurant General Manager Requirements**

* 1-2 years of Restaurant General Manager experience in restaurants
* Flexible to work nights, weekends, and holidays
* Follow Smashburger uniform standards
* Ability to follow all guidelines and procedures set forth by Smashburger, local, state, and federal employment regulations
* Must successfully complete Smashburger training program
* Possess strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively communicate with restaurant management, front line employees and corporate support teams
* People management skills to effectively select, assess, coach/counsel, develop, motivate, and lead restaurant teams
* Excellent attention to detail
* Proven time management, consistency, and organizational skills
* Highly motivated, self-directed, and results driven
* Physical ability to stand for extended periods of time and to move and lift boxes of food/ supplies up to 50 lbs.
* Ability to work in high and low temperatures

  

*\\*\\*All applicants and employees have an equal opportunity for employment and advancement within Smashburger.**Smashburger is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity.**We prohibit unlawful discrimination against applicants, prospective applicants or employees on the basis of age 40 and over, race, sex, color, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law.**This prohibition includes unlawful harassment based on any of these protected classes.**Unlawful harassment includes verbal or physical conduct which has the purpose or effect of substantially interfering with an individual’s work performance or creating an intimidating, hostile, or offensive work environment.**We maintain a workplace free of racial slurs and bias. This policy applies to all employees, including managers, supervisors, co-workers, and non-employees such as customers, clients, vendors, consultants, etc. Any conduct in violation of these company policies is also a violation of the law.**Employees who engage in, ratify, or perpetuate discrimination, harassment or retaliation will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including immediate discharge.*

title: NEW ACCOUNT REP
description:
### **Description**

**GENERAL SUMMARY**:

Under general supervision, but in compliance with established policies and procedures, perform a broad variety of customer services and sales activities such as answering telephones, providing initial customer contact by greeting customers as they enter the bank, opening new accounts including but not limited to checking, savings, certificate of deposit, IRA and safe deposit boxes. Cross-selling all services and answer questions from customers and branch staff.

**RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES**:

* Performs new accounts duties which include selling new accounts, closing accounts, advising customers on all bank services, and helping customers match the appropriate bank service to their specific need.

* Promotes bank services to customers by exchanging information with customer to introduce them to the bank and its services in person or by phone.

* Performs various customer service duties including answering telephone inquiries, ordering checks, reconciling statements, resolving disputes, etc.

* Performs cross sales.

* Assist when needed with daily Branch duties and assists with the duties of the Branch Manager in their absence. May be asked to develop promotional ideas, attend meetings, and training sessions.

* Regular and reliable attendance.

* Performs other duties as assigned by manager.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILL, AND ABILITIES**:

* Full knowledge of personal and business banking products offered, taking a personal initiative to stay updated on any changes. Basic knowledge of all banking regulations applicable to the job function and of all bank policies and procedures.
* Knowledge of general banking principles and banking regulations and a willingness to participate in educational opportunities.
* Skill in communicating with clients and co-workers in courteous and professional manner.
* Skill in operating computer terminals and printers, back counter capture machine, coin machine and copier
* Skills in effectively listening to customers and making appropriate referrals
* Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.
* Ability to perform customer service duties and provides leadership and guidance to subordinate members of the department in the areas of phone and in-person inquiries, conducting customer research, cash and check handling, and effectively making appropriate customer referrals to other bank staff.
* Ability to ensure that appropriate efficiency, accuracy, and customer service is provided to customers to ensure that the bank’s goals of meeting the customers needs is being met.
* Ability to demonstrate accuracy and efficiency in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to function as a team player.
* Ability to perform any other duties/projects as assigned by management.

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**:

* High school graduate or equivalent with six months previous banking experience.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**:

**Seeing: 75-100%**

Must be able to greet customers read documents, use computer

**Hearing: 75-100%**

Must be able to communicate with customers and co-workers

**Standing/Walking: 75-100%**

Must be able to visit customer

**Climbing/Stooping/Kneeling: 50-74%**

**Fingering/ Grasping/Feeling: 75-100%**

Must be able to use computer, write

**PHYSICAL DIMENSIONS**:

Medium Work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or a negotiable amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects

NOTE: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level or work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills, required of person so classified

### **More Details**

More Details

### **About Pinnacle Bank/Bank of Colorado**

We take pride in our heritage as a family-owned, community bank. Our commitment to our customers and community is at the forefront of how we do business.  
  
We are a Nebraska-based banking organization founded in 1938 in Palmer, Nebraska. Today, we have branches in Arizona, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, Nebraska, New Mexico, Texas and Wyoming.  
  
As we grow, our commitment to our customers and community remains as strong as ever. We specialize in building lasting banking relationships with the businesses, farms and families we serve. We also prioritize taking an active role in our communities through charitable giving and volunteering.  
  
At Pinnacle Bank, we are ready to help your company with business checking and savings accounts, commercial loans and lines of credit and treasury management services.  
  
We also offer personal banking services, including accounts, mortgages, personal loans and technology products.  
  
We offer fair and competitive compensation as well as bonus based on an employee's years of service and possible discretionary merit bonuses. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in the Bank incentive programs based on charter/branch guidelines. Other benefits include:

**\\***Paid holidays and paid time off benefits are not applicable for employees that are fully commissioned.  
  
*We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at* *personnel@pinnbank.com* *or by phone at 402-697-8666 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address. For more information, view the* *[EEO KNOW YOUR RIGHTS]* *and* *[PAY TRANSPARENCY STATEMENT]**.*

title: Assembler - General
description:
At Forte Opening Solutions, we don't just manufacture doors; we create pathways to possibilities. We empower our employees to shape the future of our industry. Join a team where craftsmanship meets cutting-edge technology, and where your ideas can open new doors. Together, we build not just products, but a culture of excellence and collaboration.

Responsibility:

* Maintaining the equipment.
* Meeting production goals as established by the Production Lead and Production Manager.
* Helping station lead identify product quality concerns and working with the lead to address these issues.
* Keeping area clean.
* Unloading drying racks as instructed by the Production Lead.
* Producing up to 100 parts per day.

Physical Demands:

* Lifting 40 pounds up to 100 times per day.
* Bending and lifting.
* Moving drying racks.
* Keeping up with the speed of the production lead to complete daily requirement.

Social Demands:

* Working and communicating with Production Manager and Production Lead on daily production needs.

Working conditions:

* Winter: Temperatures as cold as 70 degrees F for the entire shift.
* Summer: Temperatures as warm as 95 degrees F for the entire shift.

Knowledge:  

* Strong Product knowledge; Read and interpret production tickets
* Must be able to assemble all types of units pertaining to Interior and Exterior units in an accurate and timely manner to meet COQ and efficiency expectations.
* Must understand the handing of the doors. Must know the different species of jambs. Must have knowledge of how to apply the sill and hinges correctly. Must know which fire-rated labels to apply, as well as the placement.
* Minimal supervision, verify quality/accuracy/count of raw materials. Verify correct materials (species and size) to build finished product to customer specifications.

Technical

* Ability to do simple math.

Skill:

* Ability to follow direction.
* High attention to detail.

Qualifications:  

* Ability to lift up to 50 lbs., bending, twisting, stooping, pushing, excellent dexterity, must work at a fast pace and handle multiple parts, fast pace is physically demanding
* Ability to understand/read English Required
* Minimum High School Diploma
* Manufacturing experience preferred

title: Assembly Technician
company: NW Service Enterprises, Inc. Professional Assembly
description:
#NWES12

**NW Service Enterprises, Inc. (NWS) Professional Assembly** is seeking candidates for **Assembly Technician**, working on-site at local Retail Stores such as Home Depot or Lowes assembling merchandise and displays. You will assemble various products, including Barbecues, Wheelbarrows, Lawn Tractors, Work Benches, and Furniture.

Available work can fluctuate depending on the season, spiking for the Spring through Summer and then again during the Holidays. We offer flexible scheduling, which is excellent for college students searching for part-time work and those wanting full-time Monday through Friday.

At NWS, you're rewarded for your performance; with our **piecework pay model**, you can earn up to $30 per hour depending on your productivity when building merchandise. As you learn the products and develop good habits and techniques, you will gain speed, and your paycheck will grow accordingly.

If you are the handy person your friends and family would ask to help assemble a bike, barbecue, or playset, we want you to come and build for us!

**Responsibilities include:**

* Provide quality assembly and repair products and merchandise, using manufacturer instructions while adhering to retailer rules and guidelines.
* Provide excellent customer service, building and maintaining positive relationships with clients.
* Check-in with Retailer management to confirm the build list and inventory.
* Generate and complete invoices daily.
* Reports and communicates effectively to the Area Manager.
* Maintains a safe and clean workspace, leaving clients with a clean build area.
* Other responsibilities as outlined in the employee handbook.

**Qualifications:**

* Self-motivated: able to work hard with minimal supervision
* A mechanical aptitude: you are handy
* Has Basic hand tools, cordless screw gun, or impact driver
* A smartphone and e-mail address
* Internet access via a smartphone or mobile device
* Ability to pass a background test
* Ability to pass a drug test
* Must be at least 18 years old to apply
* Reliable transportation
* Capable of working on your feet for extended periods
* Kneel, bend, twist, and lift 60+ pounds repeatedly
* Experience is a plus, but we will train

title: NEW ACCOUNT REP
description:
**GENERAL SUMMARY**:

Under general supervision, but in compliance with established policies and procedures, perform a broad variety of customer services and sales activities such as answering telephones, providing initial customer contact by greeting customers as they enter the bank, opening new accounts including but not limited to checking, savings, certificate of deposit, IRA and safe deposit boxes. Cross-selling all services and answer questions from customers and branch staff.

**RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES**:

* Performs new accounts duties which include selling new accounts, closing accounts, advising customers on all bank services, and helping customers match the appropriate bank service to their specific need.

* Promotes bank services to customers by exchanging information with customer to introduce them to the bank and its services in person or by phone.

* Performs various customer service duties including answering telephone inquiries, ordering checks, reconciling statements, resolving disputes, etc.

* Performs cross sales.

* Assist when needed with daily Branch duties and assists with the duties of the Branch Manager in their absence. May be asked to develop promotional ideas, attend meetings, and training sessions.

* Regular and reliable attendance.

* Performs other duties as assigned by manager.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILL, AND ABILITIES**:

* Full knowledge of personal and business banking products offered, taking a personal initiative to stay updated on any changes. Basic knowledge of all banking regulations applicable to the job function and of all bank policies and procedures.
* Knowledge of general banking principles and banking regulations and a willingness to participate in educational opportunities.
* Skill in communicating with clients and co-workers in courteous and professional manner.
* Skill in operating computer terminals and printers, back counter capture machine, coin machine and copier
* Skills in effectively listening to customers and making appropriate referrals
* Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.
* Ability to perform customer service duties and provides leadership and guidance to subordinate members of the department in the areas of phone and in-person inquiries, conducting customer research, cash and check handling, and effectively making appropriate customer referrals to other bank staff.
* Ability to ensure that appropriate efficiency, accuracy, and customer service is provided to customers to ensure that the bank’s goals of meeting the customers needs is being met.
* Ability to demonstrate accuracy and efficiency in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to function as a team player.
* Ability to perform any other duties/projects as assigned by management.

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**:

* High school graduate or equivalent with six months previous banking experience.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**:

**Seeing: 75-100%**

Must be able to greet customers read documents, use computer

**Hearing: 75-100%**

Must be able to communicate with customers and co-workers

**Standing/Walking: 75-100%**

Must be able to visit customer

**Climbing/Stooping/Kneeling: 50-74%**

**Fingering/ Grasping/Feeling: 75-100%**

Must be able to use computer, write

**PHYSICAL DIMENSIONS**:

Medium Work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or a negotiable amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects

NOTE: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level or work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills, required of person so classified

About Pinnacle Bank/Bank of Colorado

We take pride in our heritage as a family-owned, community bank. Our commitment to our customers and community is at the forefront of how we do business.  
  
We are a Nebraska-based banking organization founded in 1938 in Palmer, Nebraska. Today, we have branches in Arizona, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, Nebraska, New Mexico, Texas and Wyoming.  
  
As we grow, our commitment to our customers and community remains as strong as ever. We specialize in building lasting banking relationships with the businesses, farms and families we serve. We also prioritize taking an active role in our communities through charitable giving and volunteering.  
  
At Pinnacle Bank, we are ready to help your company with business checking and savings accounts, commercial loans and lines of credit and treasury management services.  
  
We also offer personal banking services, including accounts, mortgages, personal loans and technology products.  
  
We offer fair and competitive compensation as well as bonus based on an employee's years of service and possible discretionary merit bonuses. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in the Bank incentive programs based on charter/branch guidelines. Other benefits include:

* 8 paid holidays\\*
* 17 PTO days each year for the first five years of employment.\\*
* After five years, 22 PTO days each year.\\*
* After ten years, 27 PTO days each year.\\*
* Employees must also complete the 90-day introductory period prior to accruing PTO.\\*
* New employees will receive 16 hours of paid sick time upon their hire date.\\*
* Health, dental, prescription drug card, vision, and voluntary life insurance plans
* Health Savings Account with employer contributions
* Flexible medical and dependent care spending plans
* Parental Leave after one year of full-time employment
* 401K plan after 3 months and start of next quarter with employer contributions and profit sharing
* Free checking account and basic printed checks
* Free safe deposit box
* $50,000 group term life insurance
* Long term disability insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Educational Assistance

**\\***Paid holidays and paid time off benefits are not applicable for employees that are fully commissioned.  
  
*We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at* *personnel@pinnbank.com* *or by phone at 402-697-8666 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address. For more information, view the* *[EEO KNOW YOUR RIGHTS]* *and* *[PAY TRANSPARENCY STATEMENT]**.*

title: Research & Development (R&D) Baker
description:
Description:

Izzio Artisan Bakery is America’s #1 Sourdough Artisan Bakery. We are spotlighting the innovation in our market, making us the fastest growing brand. At Izzio we are focused on providing our customers with great bread created using traditional methods and the best possible ingredients. Our people are a major part of our process and success.

**Position Summary**

The R&D Baker plays a central role in developing and commercializing new breads for Izzio Artisan Bakery. This hands-on position requires deep baking knowledge combined with a scientific and process-oriented approach. The R&D Baker will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to bring bread concepts to life—translating ideas and concepts into commercially scalable solutions.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Hands-On Baking & Development**

* Execute all phases of bread production: mixing, shaping, proofing, baking, and cooling to meet daily production requirements.
* Execute trials and recipe adjustments based on taste, texture, and performance.
* Work directly with ingredients to achieve the desired product outcomes.

**Recipe & Process Innovation**

* Assist in developing and refining bread recipes, ensuring each new bread is documented with detailed process notes.
* Translate consumer trends into scalable, high-quality baked goods under the guidance of sales, marketing, and Sr. R&D Manager
* Test new ingredients, methods, or processes for commercial viability.
* Maintain detailed records of test results, modifications, and outcomes.
* Record all new product development steps with accuracy for repeatability and quality assurance.

**Support Scale-Up & Trials**

* Participate in pilot and plant-scale test runs, adjusting formulations or processes as needed.
* Adapt artisan processes (e.g., long fermentation, hand shaping, hearth baking) for use in automated and semi-automated production lines.
* Collaborate with production teams to ensure a smooth handover from R&D to operations.
* Troubleshoot real-time baking issues during trials or product launches.

**Product Quality & Sensory Testing**

* Evaluate products for quality attributes such as crust, crumb, aroma, and texture.
* Ensure consistency and quality of all breads according to product specifications.
* Support shelf-life studies, packaging compatibility, and storage condition assessments.
* Ensure GMP standards, cleanliness, and food safety practices are always followed.

**Cross-Functional Support**

* Maintain clear and proactive communication with all internal and cross-functional team members.
* Participate in tastings, product reviews, and presentations.
* Help train bakery staff on new product techniques and preparation standards when needed.

Location: Louisville - No relocation assistance is offered for this position

Reports to: Sr. R&D Manager

Compensation is based on the level of experience, **other relevant experience, and requirements of the position.** *The range provided serves only as a guideline and does not automatically qualify all candidates (internal or external) for the high end of the range.*

$25.00 to $38.00 per hour, plus benefits.

Requirements:

**Position Requirements**

* A minimum of 2 years of professional baking experience. Commercial bakery experience required. Formal training in Baking & Pastry Arts is highly preferred.
* Must be able to communicate, read and write fluently/proficiently in English.
* Strong working knowledge of dough handling, fermentation, proofing, baking, and finishing.
* Ability to read formulas, scale ingredients accurately, and maintain clean, organized work areas.
* Familiarity with ingredient functionality, clean label baking formulation.
* Maintain regular, consistent attendance & punctuality. Must have a flexible schedule that may require occasional nights, weekends, and holidays.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Majority of work is performed in production environments.
* Standing, lifting (up to 50 lbs.), and working in hot environments regularly required.
* All machines are equipped with Protective guards. All safety protocols and GMP’s must be followed.

title: Assistant Manager
description:
**COMPANY PROFILE**

Club Car Wash is one of the fastest growing tunnel car wash companies in the United States. We currently operate 200+ stores throughout Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Iowa, Oklahoma, Nebraska, Wisconsin, Texas, Arkansas, Tennessee, and Colorado with plans of expanding to several other markets. With this type of growth, there is boundless opportunities for career-minded talent who strives to provide exceptional service and excellent car wash quality for all our customers. Have fun working in a professional, indoor/outdoor work environment.

**Are you ready to** **#JoinTheClub****?**

**As An Assistant Manager You Will:**

* Continuously train and support team members at varying experience levels
* Manage daily operations, support General Manager with team development and customer service
* Grow membership volume, promote Club Car Wash’s values through exceptional customer service
* Display a fresh and professional appearance at all times
* Bring a welcoming, positive attitude for our customers & team members

**What We Are Looking For In You:**

* A desire to grow your leadership skills, team building
* Ability to take initiative, multitask and problem solve
* Ability to enjoy work while outside in varying weather conditions
* Able to stand on feet for long periods of time in a fast-paced environment
* Having a sense of urgency while maintaining a friendly & courteous attitude
* Mechanical-minded individuals are a plus

**Benefitting You:**

* Incentive to earn commission
* Competitive compensation
* Career advancement opportunities for great leaders
* On-site & ongoing training and development
* Paid Time Off beginning from the day you start
* Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental and vision
* Plan for your future with 401K contribution options

**We are looking for friendly, enthusiastic people who enjoy serving customers**

— **we will teach you everything else you need to know.**

Club Car Wash is an equal opportunity employer.

All positions are contingent on passing a pre-employment drug screening and background check.
company_description: Club Car Wash is one of the fastest growing tunnel car wash companies in the United States. We currently operate 135+ stores throughout 10+ states with plans of expanding to several other markets.

title: Technology Experience Manager
description:
Requisition Number:

65335

Location:

Boulder, Colorado

City

Boulder

State

Colorado

Employment Type:

University Staff

Schedule:

Full-Time

Posting Close Date:

23-Jun-2025

Date Posted:

18-Jun-2025

### **Job Summary**

The **Book Store at CU Boulder** invites applications for a ***Technology/Sales Manager!*** This position will provide leadership and vision for the CU Book Store Technology Department. They will be responsible for developing and enhancing vendor programs to meet the technology needs of the CU Book Store customer base. They will negotiate vendor contracts and research and establish student financing options for technology hardware purchases. They will communicate with external CU departments to ensure the CU Book Store is meeting the technology needs across campus. They will collaborate with the following internal teams: accounting, marketing, ecommerce, IT, buying, POS and sales floor management. They will be responsible for managing the technology services provided by the CU Book Store. They will be responsible for managing a team of student staff to ensure superior customer service is provided, product is stocked to meet sales goals, merchandising guidelines are followed, and all policies and procedures are continually met.

CU is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. We are committed to creating a workplace where all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, and we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

### **Who We Are**

The CU Book Store offers a convenient place for students to prepare for their academic endeavors. The store offers academic course materials, and school supplies for all students, faculty and staff. We also provide logoed gear for all patrons and visitors of the university. By offering innovative services and customer centric culture, the Store strives to provide a welcoming environment for all members of the campus community, and the Boulder Community at large.

### **What Your Key Responsibilities Will Be**

*General Management of Technology Services*

* Implement and manage all vendor contracts, including Apple and Dell.
* Implement and manage all rental programs.
* Implement and manage financing options for student purchases.
* Oversee and coordinate services provided by the Technology Department, including 3D printing, laser cutting, third-party computer repair intake, and additional offerings.
* Manage and maintain relationships with external service providers to ensure quality, reliability, and alignment with departmental goals.
* Establish and maintain relationships with campus departments to ensure the Book Store is meeting technology needs across campus.
* Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends, evaluating their potential application to improve technology retail operations.
* Ensure policies and procedures are continually met and develop new standard operating procedures as needed.

*Manage the Technology Sales Floor Department*

* Ensure seamless operation of the POS system.
* Ensure student employees are provided training and product knowledge to optimize customer service experience.
* Implement and maintain technology sales floor layout and displays for optimal sales.
* Ensure ADA compliance is met in the technology area.
* Coordinate product promotions and seasonal displays to drive customer traffic and sales.
* Ensure vendor specific merchandising standards are met.
* Ensure the sales floor is restocked as needed to ensure all product is represented on the sales floor.
* Ensure inbound product is processed efficiently and in a timely manner to support continuous product availability.
* Maintain organization and clear labelling of backstock areas, ensuring easy access and efficient restocking.
* Partner with the inventory control manager on cycle counts and inventory issues.
* Partner with the buying team and the inventory control manager to ensure optimal reorder points and preferred stock levels are established and maintained to support accurate product replenishment and effective product placement.
* Partner with the marketing team to ensure store signage is updated as needed.

*Student Supervision*

* Collaborate with Student Coordinator on student employee recruitment.
* Responsible for scheduling students to ensure adequate coverage in the technology area.
* Conduct coaching sessions and performance reviews for student employees on a semester basis or as assigned.
* Set goals for student employees and foster a collaborative, productive environment.
* Approve time off and timesheets.
* Develop and implement student training programs.

*Collaborate with internal departments*

* Collaborate with sales floor and visual merchandising teams on sales floor mapping and merchandising plans for the technology department.
* Collaborate with the marketing team on efforts to optimize technology sales.
* Collaborate with the E-commerce team to ensure strong technology website representation.
* Collaborate with the IT team to ensure the technology needs across campus are met.
* Collaborate with the buying team on product assortment and will ensure vendors provide comprehensive product knowledge.
* Collaborate with the Inventory Control Manager to ensure inventory accuracy and successful replenishment program for the technology department.
* Collaborate with the accounting team on contracts and financing.
* Assist with GM physical inventory.

*Other duties as assigned, including travel*

### **What You Should Know**

* Onsite position.

### **What We Can Offer**

* The annual hiring range for this position is $60,000 - $62,000.

### **Benefits**

The University of Colorado offers excellent benefits, including medical, dental, retirement, paid time off, tuition benefit and ECO Pass. The University of Colorado Boulder is one of the largest employers in Boulder County and offers an inspiring higher education environment. Learn more about the University of Colorado Boulder.

### **Be Statements**

Be courageous. Be visionary. Be Boulder.

### **What We Require**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* At least 2 years of experience in the technology field.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a retail environment.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a supervisory role.

### **What You Will Need**

* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Strong working knowledge of MS Office.
* Strong customer service skills, interpersonal skills, and time management skills.
* Experience with retail inventory management systems and POS software.

### **What We Would Like You to Have**

* Experience with implementing and managing vendor contracts.
* Experience with NetSuite ERP.

### **Special Instructions**

To apply, please submit the following materials:

1. A current resume.

2. A cover letter that specifically tells us how your background and experience align with the requirements, qualifications, and responsibilities of the position.

We may request references at a later time.

Please apply by June 23, 2025, for consideration.

Note: Application materials will not be accepted via email. For consideration, please apply through CU Boulder Jobs.

In compliance with the Colorado Job Application Fairness Act, in any materials you submit, you may redact or remove age-identifying information such as age, date of birth, or dates of school attendance or graduation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

#### **Posting Contact Information**

**Posting Contact Name:** Boulder Campus Human Resources

**Posting Contact Email:** Recruiting@colorado.edu

title: Operations and Facilities Coordinator
description:
Requisition Number:

65337

Boulder, Colorado

City

Boulder

State

Colorado

University Staff

Schedule:

Full-Time

Posting Close Date:

30-Jun-2025

18-Jun-2025

### **Job Summary**

The ATLAS Institute in the College of Engineering and Applied Science encourages applications for the Operations Facilities Coordinator! The ATLAS Institute is an interdisciplinary research and teaching institute dedicated to integrating information technologies into all facets of modern life. The institute’s undergraduate and graduate programs encourage out-of the-box thinking and creative, hands-on exploration. The ATLAS Operations and Facilities coordinator has a wide range of duties, requiring both autonomy and discretion, to provide day-to-day operational and administrative support to ATLAS and the Roser ATLAS building tenants. This person exercises a high level of customer service as the initial ATLAS contact by answering questions, solving problems, or directing those with inquiries to the correct person in a friendly professional manner. The position reports to the ATLAS Administration Program Director.

CU is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. We are committed to creating a workplace where all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, and we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

### **Who We Are**

The Alliance for Technology, Learning and Society (ATLAS) Institute is home to radical creativity and invention, transforming ingenious ideas into reality through research, experimentation and critical thinking. ATLAS offers rigorous undergraduate, Master’s and PhD degrees in Creative Technology and Design and our project-based teaching equips the next generation of strategic problem solvers, designers and makers with cross-functional expertise valued in leading industries.

### **What Your Key Responsibilities Will Be**

*Administrative & Office Coordinator:*

* Manages the ATLAS administrative office, serving as the primary point of contact for visitors, faculty, students and vendors, as well as point-of-contact for communications via email and phone.
* Independently conducts and improves administrative tasks supporting the department as a whole, including but not limited to: reception, office organization, storage, supplies and light database management.
* Purchases supplies, equipment, and furniture for ATLAS in accordance with University purchasing policies and budgetary restrictions.
* Acts as administrative liaison for additional purchasing requests submitted by ATLAS faculty and staff in addition to management and tracking of capital asset inventory.
* Assists ATLAS leadership for priority action items, as needed.

*Building Management & Reservations:*

* Serves as the designated Building Proctor for the Roser ATLAS Building, including all departments or units housed therein.
* Coordinates furniture shifts, office reconfiguration, disposal requests, storage needs, maintenance and repair of the building, and Facilities Management requests.
* Coordinates access for student and faculty to ATLAS facilities, as appropriate, including managing CCure system and tracking permissions.
* Manages room scheduling and reservations process in support of the various activities organized by ATLAS and its units, including using the EMS system, by understanding pertinent details about building access and providing technical support as needed.
* Supervises use of public spaces and classrooms and develops tracking systems to assure cleaning, regular facility maintenance, and repairs are scheduled in a timely manner.
* Acts as the ATLAS liaison with various campus service units, including OIT, Facilities Management, Parking Services, and CUPD.

*Events:*

* Coordinates scheduling of gatherings, including staff meetings, faculty seminars, student groups and outreach efforts. Work with event hosts, both internal to ATLAS and external, to coordinate event staffing, set-up and break-down including furniture, catering, materials/hand-outs, name badges, table tents, labels, and teleconferencing.
* Collaborates with the HR Coordinator on large scale ATLAS events from ideation to execution. This includes, but is not limited to, the ATLAS Expo (student showcase), Research Open House, and other special events.
* Manages ATLAS’ Undergraduate Program and Graduate Program graduation ceremonies. Makes appropriate reservations, finalizes event timeline, orders supplies, prints programs, and recruits and coordinates volunteers.
* Coordinates with University of Colorado departments involved in event planning and large official functions, including parking, safety, catering, facilities/grounds, and University alcohol policy.
* Performs regular check-ins with the ATLAS finance team on event expenses, and ensure compliance with campus purchasing policies.

*Other:*

* Serves on program, college, and university committees as assigned.
* Performs additional duties as assigned by the Program Director, including supporting leadership, faculty, and staff priority action items and projects.
* Undertakes other duties and responsibilities, as assigned. In an employee's absence, work duties would revert back to the manager of this position.

### **What We Can Offer**

* The starting salary range for this position is $57,100 - $59,000 annually. Relocation assistance is available within CEAS guidelines.

### **Benefits**

The University of Colorado offers excellent benefits, including medical, dental, retirement, paid time off, tuition benefit and ECO Pass. The University of Colorado Boulder is one of the largest employers in Boulder County and offers an inspiring higher education environment. Learn more about the University of Colorado Boulder.

### **Be Statements**

Be inspired. Be supportive. Be Boulder.

### **What We Require**

* Bachelor's degree and one year of professional experience in Office Administration. An equivalent combination of education and experience may substitute.
* Must be able to work in-person.

### **What You Will Need**

* Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet database, and cloud computing softwares. These could include, but are not limited to: Microsoft Word, Excel, Teams, Outlook, and OneDrive as well as Google Drive, Sheets, Docs, and Forms.
* Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
* Creative problem solver with the ability to work independently as well as on a team.
* Ability to strategically conceive and coordinate and manage projects and events.

### **What We Would Like You to Have**

* Two Years of experience in Office Administration
* Work experience in higher education, especially experience working with Engineering students and/or Faculty.
* Experience interpreting and administering university policies and procedures and to take the initiative to evaluate existing processes and procedures, and when necessary, revise or develop new procedures to increase strategic operational efficiencies.
* Experience planning and leading small to large-scale events with 10 - 100+ attendees.
* Knowledge of CU systems, such as CU Marketplace, EMS, CCure, and ReADY Request.
* Ability to multi-task multiple projects.
* Experience supervising and training student employees.
* Sensitivity to and appreciation of cultural, political, and geographical differences, with ability to work well with faculty, staff, and students from around the world.

### **Special Instructions**

To apply, please submit the following materials:

* Resume or CV.
* Cover letter that briefly describes your qualifications, professional goals, and specific interest in this position.

We may request references at a later time.

Please apply by **June 30, 2025** for consideration.

*Note:* Application materials will not be accepted via email. For consideration, applications must be submitted through CU Boulder Jobs.

In compliance with the Colorado Job Application Fairness Act, in any materials you submit, you may redact or remove age-identifying information such as age, date of birth, or dates of school attendance or graduation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

#### **Posting Contact Information**

**Posting Contact Name:** Boulder Campus Human Resources

**Posting Contact Email:** Recruiting@colorado.edu

title: Night Shift Shuttle Driver - Northglenn, CO
description:
**APPLY TODAY!!!**

**Position: Night Shift Shuttle Driver -** **$18.00 - $22.00 hourly** **with a $1 Shift Differential!**

**Experience isn't required for this position.**

**Work Location:** 10420 Melody Dr Northglenn, CO 80234-4110

**Shift Information:** 4 Day work week option 7PM-6AM

**Role Overview:** As a Shuttle Driver, you'll play a vital role in ensuring the safe transportation of client vehicles to our Goodyear locations for tire and maintenance services. No prior experience is necessary; we provide comprehensive training to equip you with the skills needed for success. You'll also perform tire mounting, balancing, oil changes, and other maintenance tasks under the guidance of experienced technicians.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive pay: $18.00 - $22.00 hourly
* We offer a fun, fast paced work environment, with competitive base pay.
* Our comprehensive benefit package includes medical plans, 401(k), certification reimbursement and paid vacations.
* At Goodyear we invest in you and your future by providing excellent training for our technician, sales team and management positions. We offer fast track career advancement opportunities for hard working, team players who can deliver results.

**Basic Requirements:**

* Valid driver's license and minimum age of 18
* Authorization to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship.
* Able to lift, push and pull consumer tires and stand, squat or bend with or without reasonable accommodation

**Why Join Us:**

* Opportunities for career advancement and professional development
* Be part of a collaborative team committed to excellence and customer satisfaction
* Join a company that values and invests in its employees' success

**About Us:**

**Goodyear** owns and operates more than 580 tire and auto service centers nationwide and this role would be joining our **growing fleet business**. As the bridge between Fleet owners, managers, and other associates you will bring an outstanding service mindset that impacts others, ensures client satisfaction, and places safety as a top priority for your team at Goodyear's Fleet Service Centers.

Applications accepted on an on-going basis

title: Lead Retail Sales Associate, aka Lead Budtender
description:
**Job Title**: Lead Retail Sales Associate, aka Lead Budtender

**Location**: Fort Lupton, Colorado

**Reports to**: Store Manager

**Job Type**: Full-time

**FLSA**: Non-Exempt, Hourly

**Compensation range**: $18.00 - $18.50 (hourly)

**Benefits:**

* Employee discount, Paid Time off
* Medical, Vision, and Dental coverage (offered to full-time employees only)

**Position Summary:**  
  
The Silver Stem Fine Cannabis (SSFC) Lead Retail Sales Associate Lead Budtender is a crucial role, representing Silver Stem on the retail level and serving as the face of our brand. As the primary employee interacting with our patrons, you have the power to leave a lasting impression. Your shared goal is to guide our patrons to fully enjoy their experience, gain knowledge of our products and other cannabis accessories, and ultimately return to our establishments in the future. You also play a crucial role in maintaining functionality, efficiency, and fluidity throughout the store and among all levels of SSFC staff, the corporate team, vendors, and others.  
  
**Essential duties and responsibilities:**  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

* All Front Desk Associate duties and responsibilities
* Patient intake (Dual-use and medical licensed locations only)
* Greet and assist customers, vendors, and visitors in a friendly and helpful manner following check-in protocol
* Proper phone and email etiquette
* Complete knowledge of our Silver Seeds membership program and its benefits
* Complete understanding of our Primary Patient Program and its benefits
* Understand and fully utilize SSFC’s Point of Sale (POS) system, Flowhub
* Opening and Closing procedures
* Accurately handle cash transactions and maintain a balanced cash register
* Maintain a clean and organized work environment
* Adding products into virtual shopping carts in the POS and adhering to state-mandated daily sales limit
* Provide product recommendations and educate customers on cannabis products
* Adhere to all state and local regulations regarding the sale of cannabis products
* Adhere to SSFC policies and procedures
* Assist with the completion of daily store operations
* Assist with daily inventory audit procedures
* Maintaining knowledge of company security requirements

  
  
**Essential qualifications:**

* Must be 21 years of age or older
* Excellent customer service and communication skills
* Knowledge of different cannabis strains and products
* Experience working in a retail or customer service environment
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
* Knowledge of essential computer functions and ability to learn how to use various software and programs
* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Must have obtained a valid Employee Badge from the Colorado Marijuana Enforcement Division before the date of hire
* Must be able to lift up to 25 lbs. individually
* Must be able to sit, stand, stoop, crouch, reach, and lift for long periods

\\*\\* Reasonable accommodation(s) may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions\\*\\*

title: Collision Front Desk Receptionist
description:
AutoNation is one of the largest automotive retailers in the United States, offering innovative products, exceptional services, and comprehensive solutions, empowering our customers to make the best decisions for their needs. With a network of dealerships nationwide strengthened by a recognized brand, we offer a wide variety of new and used vehicles, customer financing, parts, and provide expert maintenance and repair services. Through DRV PNK, we have raised over $40 million for cancer-related causes, demonstrating our commitment to making a positive difference in the lives of our Associates, Customers, and the communities we serve.  
  
So what do you say? Are you ready to be part of something big?

The Collision Administrator is responsible for maintaining the front office area and assisting the Collision Manager with various tasks.

.

**What are the day-to-day responsibilities?**
---------------------------------------------

* Answer all incoming calls and direct or take messages as necessary
* Ensure that all documents are accounted for during the process of repairing a vehicle and file the completed file
* Greet customers in a timely, friendly manner
* Schedule appointments using dealership-approved forms
* Prepare all vendor invoices and assign purchase order numbers as necessary
* Obtain customer and vehicle data as needed for collision center estimators
* Establish each customer's method of payment
* Maintain Customer Satisfaction Index rating comparable to that of the manufacturer or dealership average
* Obtain customer's signature on repair order; provide customer with a copy
* Receiving invoices and matching them up with the unpaid insurance invoices before turning them in for payment
* Distribute the mail daily
* Post all funds received from the repair of a vehicle to the appropriate repair order
* Call customer when vehicle is ready and schedule the appointment for the vehicle to be picked up
* Prepare the funds for deposit by making copies of the invoices paid as well as the checks and currency received as payment for the repairs

**What are the requirements for this job?**
-------------------------------------------

* High School diploma or equivalent
* Ability to read and comprehend instructions and information
* Two years of experience in a dealership position (preferred)
* Professional appearance
* Excellent oral and written communication skills

**The compensation range for this position is $18.00 to $23.00 per hou**r (based on experience)

**Exciting Benefits and Perks Await You:**
------------------------------------------

* Competitive compensation and 401k matching
* Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with insurance plans (health, dental, vision) and maternity benefits.
* Associate purchase and discount programs for new and pre-owned vehicles, services, parts, collision, accessories, and AutoGear
* Access amazing deals and discounts through YouDecide, a website with offers from top providers and retailers
* Join our DRVPNK mission to raise and donate millions of dollars to cancer research and treatment, partnering with cancer charities nationwide

AutoNation is committed to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment in our workplace and the services we provide. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds who are passionate about making a positive impact. Even if you do not meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and help us foster a culture of belonging while contributing to our revolutionary work in the automotive industry. We value innovation, teamwork, and a commitment to making a positive impact in the world.

title: Manager, Digital Product Management
description:
**Manager, Digital Product Management**
=======================================

Requisition ID: 9605

Job Location(s):
Broomfield, CO, US, 80021

Time in Office: Onsite

**Overview**
------------

The Manager, Digital Product Management is an eCommerce technology authority who will improve the product management activities of our global digital delivery team. In this enterprise role you will be a key member of the team protecting the Crocs Inc brands (Crocs and HEYDUDE). The primary responsibility for this person will be to steward the continued growth and development of the brand’s global ecommerce platforms, vendor management, and technical delivery teams.

  

The strategic and results-driven Manager of Digital Product Management will lead the vision, strategy, and execution of our foundational technology initiatives. This role is critical in future-proofing our digital ecosystem and scaling core platforms to support business growth. You will work cross-functionally with IT, Finance, Product, Marketing and Digital (design, development, operations, and business teams) to build and optimize scalable, resilient, and high-performing digital infrastructure. This role offers an exciting opportunity to shape how we collect, analyze, and act on digital data, directly impacting business decisions and customer experience.

**What You'll Do**
------------------

* Define and drive a long-term strategy for foundational technology that supports business growth and innovation.
* Identify and implement scalable architectures, APIs, and cloud-based infrastructures that enhance agility and performance.
* Stay ahead of emerging technology, specifically headless and composable, to ensure our platforms remain competitive and adaptable.
* Develop a roadmap that balances short-term execution with long-term scalability and business impact.
* Lead digital cross-functional teams in the development and optimization of core technology platforms, OMS, PIM, DAM, HD Re-platform.
* Ensure foundational systems are secure, reliable, and high-performing while supporting evolving business needs.
* Drive agile product development methodologies and processes, ensuring rapid iteration and continuous improvement within the digital delivery team.
* Partner with development and operations to implement best practices for DevOps, automation, and infrastructure as permanent technology product.
* Inspire and align teams around a shared vision for digital transformation and foundational technology.
* Effectively engage and influence senior leadership, articulating complex technical concepts in a clear, business-driven manner.
* Champion change management and digital transformation, fostering a culture of innovation, adaptability, and continuous learning.
* Mentor and develop product managers, empowering them to take ownership and drive strategic initiatives.
* Act as a bridge between technical and business teams, ensuring alignment and removing execution roadblocks.
* Collaborate closely with cross functional teams, IT, Finance, D&L, Product, and Marketing to ensure seamless integration and operational excellence.
* Communicate technology strategies effectively to executive leadership, internal stakeholders, and external partners.
* Drive a customer-centric approach, ensuring foundational technology investments deliver tangible business value.

**What You'll Bring to the Table**
----------------------------------

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related discipline.
* 6+ years of strong proven history of working closely with business operations to identify business opportunities and requirements and deliver measurable products and features that meet those needs in a role as a Product Owner and Project Manager in a software development /e-commerce environment.
* Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams in a complex, fast-paced environment.
* Deep understanding of APIs, DevOps, and microservices architecture.
* Strong business acumen with the ability to translate technical solutions into business impact.
* Experience with Agile or other modern product development methodologies.
* Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and influencing skills.  
  Passion for driving innovation and building scalable technology ecosystems.

The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. We accept applications on an ongoing basis.

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability, or any other classification protected by law.

  

Title: Manager, Digital Product Management

Salary or Pay Range: $105,000 - $115,000

Pay offered will vary based on job-related factors such as location, experience, training, skills, and abilities.

  

At Crocs, Inc. we believe in the power of a blend of in-person and virtual collaboration to drive creativity and strengthen relationships. Your participation in this flexible schedule plays a key role in building a connected and successful team. In-office requirements vary by our work personas: Resident (5 days), Collaborator (4 days), Connector (2-3 days), Explorer (fully remote). This role has been aligned to the Collaborator persona.

  

This position is eligible to participate in a company incentive program.

  

This position is eligible for company benefits including but not limited to medical, dental, and vision coverage, life and AD&D, short and long-term disability coverage, paid time off, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program that includes company match, and many other additional voluntary benefits.

  

*The application window is 45 days, but applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as possible after the posting date in order to ensure optimal consideration. The posting will be removed if the job is filled before the application window deadline.*

Job Category: Corporate

**Nearest Major Market:** Denver
company_description: A world leader in innovative, casual footwear, Crocs, Inc. is dedicated to the future of comfort. We embrace and celebrate the uniqueness in everyone, inviting the world to Come As You Are™.

title: Account Manager
description:
**Account Manager**

Headsweats, a division of NG Labs, is in need of an experienced account manager with strong business development skills at our sales office in Boulder, Colorado. We are seeking a sales-oriented individual with excellent customer service skills and a love of the great outdoors. If that describes you, then Headsweats could be the perfect place for you. Athletes are encouraged to apply!

This is a full-time, exempt, hybrid position based out of Boulder, Colorado. The salary range for this position is $55,000 - $65,000 per year. **This position also contains a quarterly bonus potential based on sales goals.**

**Duties and Responsibilities**:

* Drive product sales by developing, identifying, and securing all relevant direct sales opportunities
* Prepare and analyze sales reports and data related to sales trends, volumes, and performance vs the established plan
* Suggest actions to improve sales performance and identify opportunities for growth
* Drive additional sales above and beyond existing sales
* Create additional business with new sales prospects
* Enter and process orders for assigned accounts
* Become intimately familiar and knowledgeable of product line
* Travel when necessary to attend various expos and events
* Create and maintain healthy and successful long term business relationships with accounts
* Provide direction, input, and feedback on sales trends, colors, styles, and sell-through
* Collaborate with the Sales, Design, and Marketing team to develop new products
* Keep up to date on competitors and brands within the marketplace and communicate findings

**Job Requirements**:

* 4 - 6 years of sales experience with experience in business development
* Successful track record in B2B sales and negotiation
* Proficiency with data analysis, forecasting, and budgeting
* Experience in the athletic or outdoor industry is a plus
* Excellent verbal, written, and computer communication skills
* Be analytic & strategic, and even-tempered
* Proficiency within a Microsoft Windows environment
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to use tact, diplomacy, and problem solving
* Be a team player and able to work in a fast-paced environment
* Bachelor's degree is recommended

**What We Offer:**

**Competitive Pay** – We believe in rewarding success and showing our employees just how much they’re valued in a variety of different ways, including compensation.

**Health and Wellness** – There’s nothing basic about our comprehensive health and wellness programs and offerings. While at work and t play, we aim to support a healthy lifestyle.

**Time away from work** – Sometimes we need time away to be with family, enjoy our hobbies, focus on our health or just simply recharge. We are committed to helping out employees create a work-life harmony!

**Growth and Development** – We are constantly seeking to offer opportunities and support for personal and professional development.

**Financial planning and wellbeing** – No matter what financial goals our employees have set, we want to help them get there. We offer access to benefits, programs, and education to help our employees to protect their income, pay for expenses and invest in the future. Including a generous 401(k) match!

**Extras, discounts, and perks** – Generous discounts to our company and related companies, is just one of the cool extras we offer!

**Equal Opportunity Employment**

DeMXXARORw

title: Area Supervisor
description:
Pay ranges from $65,000 - $75,000 based off experience and volume of the Area to be Supervised.

  

***Position: Area Supervisor***

  

***Position Overview:*** In this engaging leadership role, the **Area Supervisor** champions Papa Murphy’s commitment to quality, service, integrity, and teamwork by:

  

* Creating a positive experience and culture for your employees every day

* Hiring, training, developing, managing, and evaluating an ambitious, efficient crew of employees

* Providing incredible customer service and training store personnel to do the same.

* Flexing your business skills to create efficient operations, happy guests, and profit

* Ensuring Multi-Unit and Store Managers effectively complete duties, such as providing accurate reports, tracking and reconciling coupons and certificate, and creating and posting crew work schedules

- Ensuring all stores meet standards for optimum costs, top-notch performance , and Federal, State and Local labor laws.

- Ensuring all prep areas, equipment, and utensils meet sanitary standards in accordance with company and local health department standards.

* Baking up effective sales-building and creative local store marketing plans

* Upholding our commitment to proper operational, health, and reconciliation procedures

* Taking the lead in opening new stores

  

**What you bring to the table:**

(Position-specific knowledge, skills, abilities, and more)

  

* 5 – 7 years of awesome supervisory experience at another lucky QSR
* Multi-unit experience
* ServSafe certification required – you’re a food and beverage safety expert!
* Ability to wow an audience with strong communication skills
* Exceptional customer service skills and strategies to keep customers lining up for more pizza
* Technically wholesome: Adequate computer skills, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and POS.
* Getting down to business: You have the know-how to analyze store financials, P&Ls, break-even, food costs, labor and other financial information to positively impact store operations
* You know how to meet deadlines, just like you know how to service a customer quickly and efficiently
* Must be able to travel via automobile with a valid driver’s license…no, not just for personal vacations, but for business purposes
* Stand and walk, reach with hands, and arms, bend and stoop, kneel or crouch; this job has you on your feet up to 75% of the time.
* Must be able to lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. (Not as heavy as a lion!)

title: Veterinary Equipment Specialist - Strategic Accounts
description:
**Patterson isn't just a place to work, it's a partner that cares about your success.**

One of the distinguishing marks of our company is the talented people who embrace the people-first, always advancing, and results-driven culture. Professional growth abounds in this motivating environment. We value the diverse talents and experiences our employees bring to Patterson and believe that they build a stronger and successful organization.

**Job Description:**

The Veterinary Equipment Specialist - Strategic Accounts is responsible for all aspects of promoting and generating sales of equipment products and services within the Strategic Accounts organization.

The Equipment Specialist works closely with strategic account managers, territory managers, branch managers, and branch equipment specialists to coordinate, identify, qualify and close on equipment sales. The Equipment Specialist coordinates the installation of equipment as well as initiates and manages new and remodeled veterinary office design projects for Strategic Accounts.

To perform this job successfully, an employee must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily, with or without reasonable accommodation. To request a reasonable accommodation, notify Human Resources or the manager who oversees the position.

**Generate Sales**:

Responsible for generating sales across multiple equipment categories, increasing market penetration while maintaining acceptable gross profit levels within practices identified as strategic accounts. Seeks to understand equipment needs by asking the best questions, makes recommendations to provide solutions and closes on equipment sales. Generates referrals from current customers and manufacturing representatives. Plans, coordinates and schedules pre-sale demos and post-sale training as needed.

**Sales Planning:**

Consults with Strategic Accounts team, branch equipment specialists, Branch Managers, Territory Managers and focus customers to develop prospects for equipment sales, veterinary office designs and installation projects and other business opportunities. Makes plans to increase equipment sales volume and achieve established business objectives. During any business cycle, develops a target list of customers, works with corporate groups or field personnel to set appointments and practice visits. Develops and presents equipment solutions to all strategic accounts. Coordinates with local equipment specialist on proposals to deliver an effective design of new and existing veterinary offices to the customer.

Develops and maintains personal relationships with regional directors of corporate partners. Coordinates regular meetings with regional directors to collect information on anticipated equipment needs and opportunities.

**Customer Service**:

Provides post-sale support to customers. Demonstrates proper use of products or equipment. Responds to customer queries, answers questions and solves problems in a timely fashion. Holds client relationship meetings to monitor satisfaction levels with Patterson’s service and support and illustrates the value-added services provided. Consult with customers in choosing real estate agents, general contractors and other service providers based on customer needs. Works trade shows when required.

Professionally represents Patterson in accordance with company policies and procedures.

**Project Management**:

Prepares project schedules for equipment installations and practice remodels. Works with other departments to coordinate schedules and monitors project to completion. Meets with team and the practice regularly to maintain expectations through to project completion.

**Administrative**:

Responsible for accurate entry of customer orders to ensure prompt delivery. Review and report on all sales activities and keep up-to-date on all expense reporting. Perform other duties as assigned. Keeps detailed Equipment Prospect Pipeline in format that can be shared with others, can report with accuracy 30 and 60 day estimates on equipment sales.

**Physical Demands**

* This position requires: moderate physical activity
* Sitting or standing: Position requires both sitting which includes driving and standing
* Lifting or carrying: Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

**Required Qualifications**

* 3 – 5 years successful track record in equipment sales
* Project Management experience
* Skillful negotiation and presentation abilities
* Ability to work and contribute to a team environment
* Ability to follow up and close sales
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Computer skills

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Previous work experience in Veterinary medicine
* Computer Aided Design (CAD) skills and basic mechanical knowledge

**Please note: This role will have a travel requirement of 40%.**

**Salary Range:** **$90,000-$110,000/annual.**

**What's In It For You**

We provide competitive benefits, unique incentive programs and rewards for our eligible employees:

* Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits and an integrated Wellness Program.
* 401(k) Match Retirement Savings Plan.
* Educational Assistance Program.
* Full Paid Parental and Adoption Leave.
* LifeWorks (Employee Assistance Program).
* Patterson Perks Program.

**Compensation:**

This position is paid on a commission basis.

**EEO Statement**
-----------------

Patterson provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race; color; sex; gender identity; sexual orientation; religious practices and observances; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or other related medical conditions; status as a protected veteran or spouse/family member of a protected veteran; or disability.
company_description: At Patterson, we partner with dental and animal health professionals to create healthier communities. Together, we are transforming the way care is delivered to patients and animals.

title: Steamcleaner
description:
Would you like to be part of a focused, dedicated team? Do you want to work and grow with other motivated, ambitious people?

Wagner Equipment Co. offers challenging career opportunities, extensive training and employee development along with an opportunity to grow your career and thrive under Wagner’s reputation for excellence. We offer excellent benefits and supply you with the tools you need to maximize your potential and grow within Wagner.

**Benefits include:**

* Paid Time Off (PTO) Plan - *Up to* ***96 hours*** *of PTO in your first year + 8 company paid holidays*
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Life and AD&D Insurance
* Retirement Plans - ***401K*** *and* ***Roth 401K*** *, eligible employees can receive a company contribution up to* ***7%***
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* CEFCU- Citizens Equity First Credit Union - Employees have access to services include payroll deductions savings, accounts, loans, VISA card, and more.
* *Additional Benefits include: Unum Supplemental life Insurance, Aflac Critical Illness + Accidental Insurance, ID WatchDog and discounted employee phone plans.*

The Steamcleaner works in the wash operation cleaning and detailing machines in a manner that reflects the company’s vision of working as “One Professional Team.”

**Pay Rate:** $18.80 - $27.60 per hour  
*Pay rate is dependent upon education & experience.*

**Essential Functions:**

*Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.*

* Looks up work orders in DBS
* Cleans and details machines for Revenue, Rental, and Sales
* Cleans and details machines that are going out to customers
* Cleans tracks for the weld shop
* Operates machinery safely around the yard area
* Helps maintain the recycle equipment and the pressure washers
* Maintains polymer for mud area and mixes when necessary
* Maintains water pits and mud holding areas
* Operates the wash area skidsteer loader
* Uses high pressure wash equipment
* Uses a variety of chemicals to degrease and detail machinery
* Other duties as assigned by manager

**Required Education and Experience:**

* High School Diploma or GED
* Heavy machinery experience preferred

**Physical Demands & Competencies:**

* Standing, walking, talking, sitting, use of hands & hearing
* Ascending or descending ladders, stairs, etc.
* Heavy work that includes lifting and/or moving objects up to 100 pounds or more
* Data Entry, telephone, reading/writing, reasoning, organizational, communication & math skills
* Safety & Product Knowledge

**Work Environment:**

* Noise: Loud
* Indoors and Outdoors
* Work is done in a wet, muddy, greasy, and smelly environment

**Other Duties:**

Job Offers are contingent upon all required pre-employment screenings which may include but are not limited to background checks, drug/alcohol testing, fit for duty testing, and any other job-related tests/screenings.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills and/or abilities. To perform this job successfully, the employee must possess the abilities or aptitudes to perform each duty proficiently.

Wagner Equipment Co. is an EEO/AA/Veterans/Disabled employer.
